net.edzard.kinetic.event

Class KineticEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • net.edzard.kinetic.event.KineticEvent

  • public class KineticEvent
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    The wrapper class for Kinetic native events. Used in KineticGWT event handling system.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

    • Method Detail

      • getEventTarget

        public final Shape getEventTarget()
        Get the event target (the node that triggered this event). Useful for handling events in ancestors.
        Returns:
        The original event target

      • isProcessed

        public final boolean isProcessed()
        Gets the indicator whether this event has been set to be processed by user code before.
        Returns:
        has this event been to set to be processed?

      • setProcessed

        public final void setProcessed()
        RED ALERT: This method is not a part of KineticJS and stores a special non-standard attribute to this event.

        Set this event to be processed - useful in horizontal event stacking.
        For example, if we have a node like: 
         node.on('click.event1', some_handler1);
 node.on('click.event2', some_handler2);
        then you could programatically set the event to be processed in 'some_handler1' and check in 'some_handler2' that it has already been processed to avoid some further unwanted changes by the same event.

      • getProcessedBy

        public final java.lang.String getProcessedBy()
        Gets the identification of what has processed this event in the past, indicating this event should not be processed further.
        Returns:

      • setProcessed

        public final void setProcessed(java.lang.String processedBy)
        Method identical to setProcessed(), except that some identification of what has processed the event is passed here.
        Parameters:
        processedBy - some identification of what has processed this event

      • stopVerticalPropagation

        @Deprecated
public final void stopVerticalPropagation()
        Deprecated. 
        RED ALERT: this is currently bugged (and doesn't work) in KineticJS and is also a pending issue for future releases.

        Tells Kinetic environment to stop this event from bubbling up in the node hierarchy.
